programs.title: School Awareness Programs - Trees & Tamil Literature
programs.shortDescription: Educational sessions for students about indigenous trees, ecology, and environmental conservation rooted in Tamil literary tradition.
programs.fullDescription: Our flagship school awareness program introduces students to the rich heritage of Tamil literature's indigenous tree species. Through interactive workshops, storytelling sessions, and hands-on activities, we inspire young minds to become environmental stewards and champions of biodiversity conservation. Students learn to identify native trees, understand their ecological importance, and discover their cultural significance in ancient Tamil texts like Sangam literature and Thirukkural.

programs.title: Sustainable Farming Practices - Organic Agriculture Training
programs.shortDescription: Comprehensive training program for farmers on organic farming methods, soil health management, and sustainable agriculture techniques.
programs.fullDescription: This intensive training program equips farmers with knowledge and practical skills for transitioning to sustainable agriculture. Participants learn organic farming principles, soil conservation techniques, water management strategies, integrated pest management, and cultivation of indigenous crop varieties suited to Tamil Nadu's diverse climate zones. The program combines classroom theory with hands-on field demonstrations at our model organic farm in Coimbatore district.

programs.title: Tree Conservation & Biodiversity Protection Initiative
programs.shortDescription: Community-driven conservation program protecting endangered indigenous tree species and restoring natural habitats in Tamil Nadu.
programs.fullDescription: This ongoing conservation initiative focuses on protecting endangered indigenous tree species mentioned in Tamil literature and restoring degraded forest patches through community participation. Working with forest departments, local communities, and schools, we identify threatened native species, establish conservation plots, conduct seed collection drives, and create community nurseries. The program also documents traditional knowledge about tree uses from village elders and conducts regular biodiversity monitoring with citizen scientists. Special focus on sacred grove restoration and rare species like Red Sanders, Sandalwood, and Ebony.
programs.ageGroup: All ages (youth and adults preferred for fieldwork)
objectives: Protect and propagate endangered indigenous tree species of Tamil Nadu
Restore degraded forest patches and sacred groves through community action
Document traditional knowledge about indigenous trees from local communities
Create community seed banks and native species nurseries
Build citizen scientist network for biodiversity monitoring
outcomes: Conservation plots established protecting 50+ endangered species
Community nurseries producing 10,000+ native saplings annually
Traditional knowledge documented from 100+ village elders
Restored sacred groves serving as biodiversity hotspots
Active network of 200+ citizen scientists monitoring forest health

duration.frequency: Monthly field visits + quarterly conservation camps

programs.fullDescription: This comprehensive program helps companies fulfill their CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) commitments while making genuine environmental impact. We design customized initiatives aligned with company values and employee interests - from large-scale tree plantation drives to sustainability workshops for employees.
